reviewText:
Interesting concept, quite different from the standard fare.
You quickly get used to the controls and interface, so it's off to battle in a matter of seconds.

Gulf of Aden actually requires nautical and/or tactical thinking and is not as easy as it might appear.  Be prepared to get your backside kicked a few times before you master certain levels (I did!).

A new original concept which I like and recommend.  Can't wait for more installments!
voteText: 9 of 9 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
At first glance it seems relatively simple and straight forward, but it's actually quite a nice blend between a tower defense game and RTS-micromanagement.

The missions force you to review your strategy as there isn't really a single strategy that's effective in any map. Sometimes you'll need fast ships and mobillity and sometimes you want to turtle up and bring out the big guns.

Oh and the whole sea charts in the captain's cabin setup is a really nice touch.

Really liked it.
voteText: 5 of 5 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
This is a different take on tower defence, if you like strategy games, it might be for you to play.

I did like the challenging nighttime missions


7/10
